channel.title: NPR All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Ari Shapiro, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.

item.title: Why everyone is talking about 'Love Island' this season
item.description: This summer marks the seventh season of the USA spinoff of Love Island. Why has this one caught fire in a way that previous seasons haven't?

item.title: South Carolina honors Robert Smalls with first statue of a Black man at the Capitol
item.description: The South Carolina Capitol grounds will soon include a statue of Robert Smalls, a formerly enslaved Civil War hero, among the statues of five white men, most with ties to the Civil War or Jim Crow.

item.title: A look at Syria's growing pains half a year after opposition fighters took power
item.description: In Syria, it's been more than six months since Bashar al-Assad's regime was toppled by opposition fighters after decades in power and years of civil war.

item.title: Selling his old stamp collection, a reporter looks back through history and memory
item.description: A freelance reporter in London tries to sell his boyhood stamp collection and takes a journey through memory and vanished nations.

item.title: Rural areas face unique challenges when responding to disasters
item.description: President Trump landed in Texas Friday to visit areas ravaged by floods. NPR's Ari Shapiro speaks with Dianna Bryant about the challenges rural areas face in preparing for and responding to disasters.

item.title: Prime Day — er, Days — tests deal hunters' will to spend amid tariffs
item.description: Electronics and back-to-school supplies are expected to top many shoppers' lists.

item.title: Iconic Birkin bags are pricy — but the original just fetched a stunning $10 million
item.description: The original Birkin bag — made specifically for the singer and actress Jane Birkin — just sold for more than $10 million at Sotheby's in Paris.

item.title: More college students now learn entirely online than completely in-person
item.description: This year is the first time that more U.S. college students will learn entirely online compared to being fully in-person. And research shows most online programs cost as much or more than in-person.

item.title: 2 years ago, Amanda Anisimova put down her racket. Now she's in the Wimbledon final
item.description: Anisimova was a teenage tennis prodigy. But by 2023, tournaments had become "unbearable" for her mental health, and she stepped away. Now, she is a win away from her first Grand Slam title.

item.title: Environmentalists celebrate rare win as Georgia swamp is saved from mining threat
item.description: Environmentalists are celebrating a rare win of keeping a mining operation from opening up next to a National Wildlife refuge in South Georgia.
